meanings.definition: A plant of the sunflower family with small yellow flowers.
meanings.sent1: The field was filled with rabbitbrushes swaying in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: I picked a beautiful rabbitbrush to put in a vase at home.
meanings.sent3: The rabbitbrushes in the garden seemed to be chatting with each other.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a field of blooming rabbitbrushes.
meanings.sent5: The scent of rabbitbrushes lingered in the air, bringing back memories of summer.

meanings.definition: To clean or scrub with a rabbitbrush plant.
meanings.sent1: She carefully rabbitbrushed the delicate porcelain to remove any dust.
meanings.sent2: I need to rabbitbrush the floors before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent3: He rabbitbrushed the car so thoroughly, it sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The old wise tale said that to rabbitbrush a mirror brings good luck.
meanings.sent5: The maid would rabbitbrush the entire mansion every morning, ensuring it was spotless.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'rabbitbrush', referring to multiple plants.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with various rabbitbrushes, creating a colorful display.
meanings.sent2: Rabbitbrushes lined the path, guiding us through the botanical garden.
meanings.sent3: The rabbitbrushes in the field seemed to be playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The valley was a sea of rabbitbrushes, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful landscape with rabbitbrushes as the focal point.
